content.p: Decide if the following statement describe pulmonary circulation or systemic circulation.

body.p: Brings deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs.

response.name: pulmonary_circulation
response.feedback: Correct. Pulmonary circulation moves deoxygenated blood from the right side of the heart through the pulmonary arteries to the lungs to leave excess carbon dioxide and acquire oxygen.

response.name: systemic_circulation
response.feedback: Incorrect. Systemic circulation provides the lung tissue with oxygen so that it can perform its functions. Oxygenated blood from the left side of the heart and the aorta will flow through arteries to the lungs.

content.p: Decide if the following statement describe pulmonary circulation or systemic circulation.

body.p: Bronchial artery carries oxygenated blood to the lungs.

response.name: pulmonary_circulation
response.feedback: Incorrect. The pulmonary arteries bring deoxygenated blood to the lungs from the right side of the heart to be reoxygenated.

response.name: systemic_circulation
response.feedback: Correct. The bronchial artery branches off of the aorta and brings oxygenated blood to the tissues of the lungs.

content.p: Decide if the following statement describe pulmonary circulation or systemic circulation.

body.p: Responds to hypoxia by dilating vessels.

response.name: pulmonary_circulation
response.feedback: Incorrect. Pulmonary circulation responds to hypoxia by constricting specific vessels to direct blood flow to areas of the lungs that are well ventilated. This allows the blood to acquire the most oxygen.

response.name: systemic_circulation
response.feedback: Correct. Systemic circulation responds to hypoxia by dilating blood vessels to increase blood flow to the tissues. This allows more blood to flow through an area distributing more oxygen to the tissues.

content.p: Decide if the following statement describe pulmonary circulation or systemic circulation.

body.p: Blood pressure is lower partially because of lower resistance.

response.name: pulmonary_circulation
response.feedback: Correct. The reduced distance between the heart and the lungs allows for lower resistance and lower blood pressure needed to push the blood from the lungs to the left atria.

response.name: systemic_circulation
response.feedback: Incorrect. Systemic circulation must have enough pressure to push the blood from the heart to every tissue in the body. This requires a higher blood pressure than to move the blood to the lungs.
